isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - DISASSEMBLE - SHIFT LEVER AND TOWER ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: 7.1.1. Aluminum Shift Lever and Tower Assembly

figure.caption: Figure 74. Aluminum Shift Lever And Tower Assembly

note.para: If an aluminum shift tower assembly is replaced, replace the entire assembly with a cast iron shift tower assembly. Make sure the gasket between the shift tower housing and the top cover housing is replaced. A different gasket is used on the aluminum than on the cast iron housing.

step1.para: If necessary, separate the upper shift lever from the lower shift lever.

step2.para: If clips are used, remove one clip. Remove the clip and pin assembly from the lever. Remove the bushings ( Figure 75).
If a bolt and nut are used, remove the nut and the bolt.
Remove the upper shift lever from the lower shift lever (Figure 75).

figure.caption: Figure 75. Remove Upper Shift Lever From Lower Shift Lever

step1.para: Remove the clamps that fasten the boot to the housing. Remove the boot from the housing and the lower shift lever.
Put the assembly in a vise with brass jaws. Make sure the inside of the housing is away from you.
Remove the snap ring that fastens the upper retainer plate and the lever in the housing (Figure 76).
Remove the set screws from the side of the housing. Remove the lower retainer from the housing (Figure 77).
Lift on the lever to remove the lever and the upper retainer plate from the housing (Figure 78).

figure.caption: Figure 78. Remove Lever and Upper Retainer Plate

note.para: Two or three spring washers may be used in the housing. Make sure the same number of washers are installed.

step1.para: Remove the spring washers from the housing (Figure 79).
Inspect all parts. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT section.

figure.caption: Figure 79. Remove Spring Washers From Housing

svcsubproc.title: 7.1.2. Cast Iron Shift Lever and Tower Assembly

figure.caption: Figure 80. Cast Iron Shift Lever and Tower Assembly

step1.para: If necessary, separate the upper shift lever from the lower shift lever.

step2.para: If clips are used, remove one clip. Remove the clip and pin assembly from the lever. Remove the bushings ( Figure 81).
If a bolt and nut are used, remove the nut and the bolt (Figure 81)t.
Remove the upper shift lever from the lower shift lever.

figure.caption: Figure 81. If Used, Remove Nut and Bolt

step1.para: Remove the clamps that fasten the boot to the housing. Remove the boot from the housing and the lower shift lever.
Put the assembly in a vise with brass jaws.
Remove the spiral snap ring that fastens the spring, the spacer and the lower lever in the housing.
Lift on the lower lever to remove the lever. Remove the spring and the spacer from the lower lever.
Inspect all parts. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT section.
